info.title: Pioneer Customer Experience API
info.description: API for managing customer details and accounts for Pioneer Finance

tags.name: bank-statements
tags.description: Operations related to bank statement data integration

tags.name: applications
tags.description: Operations related to consumer lending applications including personal loans, in-store finance, and other credit products

tags.name: channels
tags.description: Operations for accessing distribution channels through which products are offered.

tags.name: partner
tags.description: Endpoints for managing partner details including lookup, search, and administration. These endpoints are primarily designed for admin and staff users who need to access and modify partner information by partner ID.

tags.name: dashboard
tags.description: Dashboard endpoints providing comprehensive financial overviews for authenticated users. These endpoints aggregate data from loan accounts, bank accounts, and affordability analysis to present a unified financial dashboard experience.

tags.name: channels
tags.description: Operations for accessing distribution channels through which products are offered

tags.name: financials
tags.description: API for managing financial information including income sources, expenses, and loan commitments

tags.name: me
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the currently authenticated user's details. These endpoints allow customers to view and update their own information when logged in, providing a personalized self-service experience.

tags.name: lms
tags.description: LMS endpoints providing loan management system functionalities for internal services. These endpoints facilitate operations such as retrieving account quotes, managing loan details, and processing transactions within the LMS.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: Endpoints for fetching metadata including purposes, address types, and other enumerated values. These endpoints are primarily designed for users who need to access metadata information.

post.description: Resets the current user by renaming them with a numbered suffix (e.g., user@example.com becomes user_1@example.com) and creating a fresh new user with the original email. This preserves old data while providing a clean slate.

get.description: Retrieves the current status of privacy policy and terms acceptance for the authenticated user

post.description: Updates privacy policy and/or terms acceptance status for the authenticated user. Creates the user if they don't exist.

get.summary: Get client personal details of login user
get.description: This is used to query client personal details such as marital status, living situation, etc.

value.message: No personal details found for the customer

post.summary: Create or update personal details of login user
post.description: This is used to create or update client personal details. Only residencyStatus and employmentStatus are mandatory fields. Other fields will default to 'Unknown' or appropriate default values if not provided.

get.summary: Get both basic and personal details of login user
get.description: This is used to retrieve both basic and personal details in a single call. This endpoint is more efficient than making separate calls to both /basic-details and /personal-details.

post.summary: Create or update both basic and personal details in one call
post.description: This endpoint allows updating both basic and personal details in a single transaction. It respects the same validation rules as the individual endpoints. A minimal request needs only the required fields: firstName, lastName, phoneNumber, dob, gender, at least one address, residencyStatus, and employmentStatus.

get.summary: Get basic details of login user
get.description: This is used to query client basic details such as name, date of birth, etc.

post.summary: Create or update basic details of login user
post.description: This is used to create or update client basic details such as name, date of birth, etc.

value.message: Invalid phone number format: must follow New Zealand phone number pattern

post.description: Creates a verification session and returns a link for the user to complete verification

value.message: Failed to initiate identity verification: Error connecting to CloudCheck service

get.description:
Retrieves detailed financial information for the authenticated user (not specific to any application). Response Schema:

- **income**: Array of income sources with type, frequency, and amount
- **expenses**: All household expense categories with amounts and frequencies
- **otherLoans**: Array of existing loans with details on lender, type, amount owing, and payment schedule

post.description:
Creates or updates financial information for the authenticated user. Schema Requirements:

- **income** (Required): Array of income sources
  - **type**: Enum (Salary, Wages, Part_time_casual, Self_employed, IRD, Rental_border, Super, Benefit, Other_income, Other)
  - **frequency**: Enum (Weekly, Fortnightly, Monthly, Irregular)
  - **amount**: Decimal (NZD)

- **expenses** (Required): Household expenses
  - All expense fields are paired with corresponding frequency fields
  - Example: telephoneexpenses + telephonefrequency
  - All frequencies: Enum (Weekly, Fortnightly, Monthly)
  - Categories include: telephone, mobile, power, rates, rentBoard, childCare, insurance, vehicle, and others

- **otherLoans** (Optional): Array of existing loans
  - **debtor**: String (lender name)
  - **type**: Enum (Mortgage, Personal, Vehicle, Credit_Card, Other)
  - **amountOwing**: Decimal (NZD)
  - **regularPayment**: Decimal (NZD)
  - **regularPaymentFrequency**: Enum (Weekly, Fortnightly, Monthly)

error.message: Invalid data format: amount must be a positive number

get.summary: Get financial information for an application
get.description:
Retrieves detailed financial information linked to a specific application. Response Schema:

- **income**: Array of income sources with type, frequency, and amount
- **expenses**: All household expense categories with amounts and frequencies
- **otherLoans**: Array of existing loans with details on lender, type, amount owing, and payment schedule

404.description: Application not found or user has no access

post.summary: Update financial information for a specific application
post.description: Creates a new UserFinancials record specifically for the given application ID without affecting other UserFinancials records for the user.

error.message: Invalid data format: amount must be a positive number

200.description: Successfully created financial information for application

data.message: Successfully created new financial information for application 12345

Triggers re-enrichment of transactions for a connection

get.summary: Get additional contacts for an application
get.description: Retrieve all contacts associated with the specified application. Returns a list of contacts with their name, email, and phone number. Only the main applicant or co-applicants listed in the application can access this endpoint.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: ID of the application to get contacts for

401.description: Unauthorized - Not an applicant for this application

value.message: User not authorized - not an applicant for this application

post.description: Add alternative contacts  to an application. Each contact includes a name, email address, and optional phone number. If the application is in the 'ProvideAlternativeContactMethods' stage, this will advance the application to the next stage. Only the main applicant or co-applicants listed in the application can access this endpoint.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: ID of the application to add contacts to

value.message: Validation failed: Email must be valid

401.description: Unauthorized - Not an applicant for this application

value.message: User not authorized - not an applicant for this application

get.description: Get information about top-up eligibility for the user's latest application. Returns the new top limit amount, a reference ID for processing the request, and a confirmation message. Use the returned reference ID when making the actual top-up request.

post.description: Request additional funds on the user's latest application using a reference ID. The reference ID should be obtained from the GET /topup endpoint first. This endpoint accepts the request for future processing.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Reference ID obtained from GET /topup endpoint

400.description: Bad request - Missing or invalid reference parameter

post.description: Create a new consumer lending application for yourself or for a client you manage. Supports personal loans, in-store financing, and other credit products. Required fields and validation rules are determined by the selected product's configuration. Optional fields allow for customization of term length, interest-free periods, and repayment frequency.

value.message: Purpose is required; Amount is required; ProductId is required

401.description: Unauthorized or no access to user

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available financial products with optional filtering options. This endpoint can be filtered by channel ID OR partner branch ID (not both). If both filters are provided, partner branch ID takes precedence. If no filters are provided, all products will be returned. The response includes detailed product information including settings, limits, fees, and interest rates. Products include revolving credit options like EasyCard and fixed installment options like Personal Loans.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: ID of the channel to filter products by. Do not use together with partnerBranchId.

parameters.name: partnerBranchId
parameters.description: ID of the partner branch to filter products by. Takes precedence over channelId if both are provided.

200.description: Successfully processed but no products found

data.name: Personal Loan
data.description: Personal Loan for up to 100k. Finance anything.

data.name: EasyCard
data.description: Purchase in-store at participating retailers across New Zealand

get.description: This is used to get a specific product by its ID.

get.description: This is used to query the list of length of time available in the system.

get.description: Retrieves user policy status and the latest master contract application details. Returns user email, policy acceptance status, and if available, the latest application ID, stage, and status where masterContract is true.

400.description: User not found or validation failed

get.description: Retrieves the current identity verification status for the authenticated user

get.summary: Generate file upload URL for application documents
get.description: Generates a secure URL for uploading files to Google Cloud Storage. This URL can be used by clients to upload documents directly to the application folder. The URL is valid for a limited time (15 minutes) and automatically organizes files in application-specific folders for better organization and security.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Optional file name. If not provided, a unique name will be generated.

value.message: Error generating signed URL: Invalid file name format
You don't have access to this application

get.description: Creates a new DocuSeal document for signing. This endpoint checks if a document already exists for the application and returns it if found. Otherwise, it creates a new document and auto-signs the Pioneer portion.

value.message: Error generating document: Application not found
You don't have access to this application

get.description: Returns the signing URL and slug for embedding in mobile apps. This endpoint is specifically designed to support mobile integration according to DocuSeal's mobile SDK requirements. It returns the necessary parameters for embedding the document signing interface in Android and iOS applications.

value.message: Error getting mobile signing URL: Could not generate document
You don't have access to this application

get.summary: Get transactions for a specific account
get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of transactions for a specific account from LMS. This endpoint allows users to view their transaction history for a given account, with support for pagination.

200.description: Successful financial dashboard response with all transactions

400.description: Invalid request or user authentication failed

500.description: Internal server error while aggregating financial data

get.summary: Get Akahu transactions for a specific account
get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of Akahu transactions for a specific account. This endpoint allows users to view their Akahu transaction history, with support for pagination.

200.description: Successful financial dashboard response with akahu transactions

items.description: ATM Withdrawal Demo Bank Queen St

400.description: Invalid request or user authentication failed

500.description: Internal server error while aggregating financial data

get.description: Retrieves a comprehensive financial dashboard showing: 1) Financial Summary - Total available funds, Monie credit, due amounts, and credit limits from affordability analysis 2) Loan Products - User's loan/credit accounts grouped by product type (from Payment API) with utilization, balances, and payment details 3) Bank Accounts - Connected bank accounts grouped by bank name with current and available balances. This endpoint integrates data from multiple sources including Payment API accounts, product cache, bank connections, and affordability analysis to provide a complete financial overview aligned with the mobile app dashboard design.

200.description: Successful financial dashboard response with all user financial data

loanProducts.productDescription: Flexible credit line for everyday expenses

400.description: Invalid request or user authentication failed

value.data: User authentication failed. Please ensure you are logged in with a valid email header.

500.description: Internal server error while aggregating financial data

value.data: Failed to get financial overview: Unable to aggregate financial data from external services

Retrieve all applications associated with the currently authenticated user. Returns a list of applications with their ID, stage, processing state, status, creation date, update date, and partner branch details if applicable.

error.message: User not authenticated or invalid authentication credentials
An unexpected error occurred while retrieving user applications

get.description: Retrieve information about a specific application using its unique ID, with optional detailed view. Returns the application's current stage, status, and processing state as defined in the backend-driven workflow. Applications follow a state management system with distinct stages (e.g., CreatePioneerApplication, AwaitBankStatements), overall statuses (e.g., Submitted, Approved, Declined), and processing states (AwaitingAction, Processing, Complete, Error). When include-details=true, comprehensive information about the application is returned.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: ID of the application to retrieve

applicationDetails.notes: Customer prefers auto-payments from their account

error.message: You do not have access to this application

403.description: Forbidden - No access to requested application

error.message: You do not have access to this application

dependants.description: Number of dependants the customer has. Possible values: None, 1, 2, 3 or more, Unknown
